website_summaries.verdict: The elongated blind spot mirror to choose when you want more rear coverage.
pros: Long, narrow mirror design extends the rear view to cover several lanes of traffic
Can rotate the mirror 360 degrees for a more vertical view of the car's blind spots
cons: Fragile mirrors can crack or break when repositioning or removing them

customer_reviews.title: This adjustable blind spot mirror is absolutely perfect. No more straining my neck having to look ...
customer_reviews.text: This adjustable blind spot mirror is absolutely perfect. No more straining my neck having to look over my shoulder every few minutes. Took a slow-mo video to show how much better it is than the original side view mirror on my Mercedes E350.
customer_reviews.author: Zain Dada

customer_reviews.title: Almost like European cars
customer_reviews.text: All the round blind spot mirrors, I have tried, leaving me fairly unsatisfied. This one is outstanding, even at night. It provides the landscape size panoramic view of those standard spherical mirrors all European cars have on the passenger as well as on the drivers side.
customer_reviews.author: GJM

customer_reviews.title: Works well but be careful when placing
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and does what it says. Only thing is to be very careful where you choose to place it. I poorly placed it on the mirror and it can not be removed and reused. It holds very strong, so you only get one chance.
customer_reviews.author: vythien

customer_reviews.title: Greatly improved blind spot visibility
customer_reviews.text: Theses mirrors work great for improving blind spot visibility. They stick out further from the side view mirror than I expected, but the gap allows for more adjustability. The adhesive is very strong. I accidentally placed one of the mirrors higher than I wanted. I was able to pull it off by plying off one corner with a thin laminated ID card and gently pushing on the mirror in the opposite direction.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mercat

customer_reviews.title: A wider view
customer_reviews.text: This mirror effectively eliminates the driver's blind spot. I used this mirror to replace a round one that became marred after a few years and useless for its purpose. This particular mirror may or may not last for years, but for the time it does a far more thorough job of covering that area outside the drivers field of vision than the round one did.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: augment you FOV
customer_reviews.text: I had large blind-spots on either side of a work van that I was just not confident I could assure the safety of myself and those around me using just the regular mirrors. i bought these and attached them easily. they pivot a limited degree to fine tune your view. I've already screwed up and had to detach and reattach them :P with no problems. has definitely increase my confidence with situational awareness within my vehicle. I can see people who'd be invisible to my standard mirrors. easier to spot suspicious persons trying to approach from the sides.
customer_reviews.author: L11

customer_reviews.title: Square version is mediocre, not enough blind spot coverage
customer_reviews.text: The square version does not provide enough wide angle to give you the blind spot coverage. Angle of view is pretty narrow compared to other mirrors and adjustability limits don't allow to turn the mirror correctly to see the blind spot. The little square blind spot mirror without the adjustable base from your local auto- or big department store is way better (tried those). This one only looks fancy but functionally mediocre.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have the swivel action to adjust up down ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well on my Genesis Rspec coupe. I put on upper top left of both mirrors to see those cars in the blind spots the factory mirrors do not show you. YOU REALLY ARE to CLOSE if you just have the stock mirrors on your car. Peel n stick design. Nice to have the swivel action to adjust up down left right.
customer_reviews.author: Jon B

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, this definitely makes life 10x easier. My mirrors zoom too close so I can never see the car next to me. Now this made it better! Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: A. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: These mirrors have saved my neck so many times. I spend a good deal of the day commuting to work and I used to have to crank my neck constantly to check my blind spot. But with these mirrors, no longer! I love that these swivel and adjust. My only concern is that something might knock the mirror out of place and mistakenly believing they're still in place, I'll hit a car in my blind spot. Wish there was a way to lock these into place. But very minor thing.
customer_reviews.author: X. Wang

customer_reviews.title: Great Mirror
customer_reviews.text: My car has a massive blind spot on the driver's side - they try to deal with it by using a warning triangle and a beep. I don't think that is enough and I want to see what's there. Plus I wanted one that was not too big and matched the shape of the one on the car. This one does ALL of that! My only negative is the image is a little too distant (takes in too much area and looks small). I'll live with that and enjoy being able to see. Here in the LA area it's really important.
customer_reviews.author: Michael - LA

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected :(
customer_reviews.text: First, place on the outside toward the lower part of the mirror. The picture showed the inside, so that is what I did. I can’t see the parking lines when I reverse now. Also it makes more sense to put something on the outside if you are trying to widen your view. The adhesive is so strong I can’t get it off without breaking my mirror. Plus every time I go through the car wash I have to readjust them which is more trouble than it is worth. I would go with a round, non adjustable version.
customer_reviews.author: Livlikno1else

customer_reviews.title: Winter Ready?
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these without considering "What happens in Minnesota Winters?" As the mirror is elevated above the main mirror surface, several issues can happen: Ice and Snow can find their way behind. Ice will either pop the mirror off or cause misalignment. Clearing mirrors with a snow brush will either cause loss or misalignment. Car Washes, as others have noted, will also be a problem. Test drove them and found the image areas very small. Unimpressed.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Guy

customer_reviews.title: nice shape, quality is something to be desired.
customer_reviews.text: Received these mirrors today, one of them arrived totally broken and the other one has a slight chip at the bottom. The one that was mostly in-tact seems like it will work well, but I am disappointed I paid almost $10 for defective items. I would request a return but I really need at least 1 so I guess I have to deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: W

customer_reviews.title: Would NOT repurchase
customer_reviews.text: These just didn't work for me. I don't know if it's the configuration of my car's body or what, but the mirrors actually blocked my view instead of providing more. The stickiness was also disappointing, as one of them wouldn't stick, and the other lost 100% stickiness after I tried rearranging it. If one hadn't fallen off while driving, I'd return them.
customer_reviews.author: Talley

customer_reviews.title: Just as pictured -- and they help a lot
customer_reviews.text: For my new car I still needed some help on the passenger side with visibility, and I didn't want either the useless little round ugly ones or the larger ones I used for a while on the old car. These are perfect. Because of how my car is designed (as well as my neck), I need to be able to see 2-3 lanes over because of an area in town where there is oncoming traffic at a 120 degree angle -- I can't turn my head far enough to see it. (Dumb design!) This little mirror has saved me. The adjustability is a great help because you probably have different visibility issues on each side of the car.
customer_reviews.author: Linda ScottTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mirrors!
customer_reviews.text: Oh, these are GREEAAAAT. I bought some for my boyfriend and liked them more than mine. He ended up buying a new car and forgot them on his old one he had traded in. Which means I ordered him new ones and bought myself a pair this time. The mirror is so clear, you can see EVERYthing to the side and behind you. You can set them up on any side or part of the mirror and they work great. Durable, clear, bright, awesome. I almost didn't like them at first because I could see !too! much compared to my old, dinky, little, cloudy, circle ones.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay up after a year
customer_reviews.text: I've had this a little over a year and now the mirror doesn't stay where it was originally positioned. My guess is through vibrations, the mirror collapses on its own weight and before not long all I see is the road and not the blind spot area. One exhibiting behavior could just be defect, but both side having the same symptom is just bad design or product. BUY something else.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Velazco

customer_reviews.title: Recommend, these mirrors are really helpful
customer_reviews.text: Spent some time trying to find the right place for the mirrors. I would advise to ask for someone's help to hold the mirrors in different places before sticking them, so that the driver can adjust final position (3M might get hard to unstick). Other option is to use "light" double-sided tape for calibration. Car: Hyundai Sonata 2011
customer_reviews.author: Sergey

customer_reviews.title: Great idea though
customer_reviews.text: Didn't match the contour of my mirror as well as I expected and looked out of place. Don't mount too close to the edge as it will hit the rim of the mirror. To get the angle (blind-spot) I wanted I had to mount it towards the outer edge of my 2009 dodge charger which doesn't work as well with the shape. Great idea though. I'll be buying one with a different shape just to get a cleaner look.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Good for my Tesla 3
customer_reviews.text: I love my Tesla however my only complaint is the lack of a blindspot monitor in the actual mirrors (as opposed to almost every other newer car). Tesla has a blindspot monitor in the actual center screen, but that doesn’t work well for me. These blind spit mirrors are perfect to supplement the car. Now i can perfectly see the blindspots. Very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Solid mirror and is weathering the elements great. My concern is that the shape of the mirror makes it hard to see the blind spot and surrounding area compared to a circular mirror. Have had trouble adjusting the mirror as well and the instructions were not that helpful - the positions they recommended didn’t match with any of the pictures when advertised. Didnt fail, prefer a circular mirror is all - unsure about recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Truly a must have in busy traffic!
customer_reviews.text: From the first day I installed these I realized that they truly are simnple and yet so indispensible to see the blind spot easily day or night. Have been in pouring rain and stay right where I placed them, the product feels of high quality material and not flimsy. Truly these mirrors intergrate into my cars look that they look like they came with the car. Highly recommend these over other cheap knock offs.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. C

customer_reviews.title: They do the trick and the sticky backing really holds ...
customer_reviews.text: They do the trick and the sticky backing really holds well. But they look too big for my mirror, so I took it off, unfortunately the bracket base is still stuck to the mirror.
customer_reviews.author: D.Roccoli

customer_reviews.title: Good blindside/curbside mirrors!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product on for a few weeks, adhesion has held up so far. I dont really know how long it will last with environmental factors. Mirror looks very clear. Only issue I've found was that when you wash your car and wipe your mirrors, if you accidently move the swivel, you will have to reset to the position to your liking! Its a little pain to adjust the passenger mirror everytime alone unless you have help! But works great if you don't mind repositioning once in a while
customer_reviews.author: Angel L.

customer_reviews.title: Stable. Easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with this, bought these for my wife’s VW Tijuan. I will definitely replace these into my dodge. Easy to adjust. Adhesive is strong. For the price a lot better than what I have on. Magnification isn’t too Extreme. Im in a drive thru and it’s packed so I have time for this. As u can see a vehicle is exiting. Can’t see it fully on my mirror. How ever. Perfectly boxed into this blind spot. Right side is same.
customer_reviews.author: D&M

customer_reviews.title: Mirrors pivot to get in "just right" position
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful to decrease blind spots while driving. Attached to top right of driver's side mirror & top left of passenger side mirror. Made several adjustments to get each at most advantageous angle. (FAR superior to little dinky round mirrors I used to have.) These mirrors pivot for optimal positioning. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: DonnaMarie113

customer_reviews.title: This product works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a long journey in our '11 Element; never felt safer or more sure on the road, especially through Tucson & Albuquerque traffic! Just ordered a second set for our '05 Element. Works great, adhesive stays, very adjustable. I folded my mirrors in going through the car wash to protect them but otherwise no maintenance. Definitely worth the money and then some!
customer_reviews.author: Sagwagon Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best blind-spot mirror I have owned
customer_reviews.text: This is simply the best blind spot mirror I have ever used. -- I cannot recommend it too highly. The wide aspect ratio is great, and the ball joint connection makes it easy to adjust to exactly the right angle. I love it. It even looks good on the mirror -- more like factory installed than an add-on part. If you need a blind spot mirror do not hesitate -- get this one. Really.
customer_reviews.author: 90Below

customer_reviews.title: Great for driver's side Tesla Model 3
customer_reviews.text: I am not a fan of the side mirrors on the Model 3 as, at least for me, the blind spots they leave are huge. I installed these on both side mirrors and the improvement on the driver's side is huge. The passenger's side...not so much. I stuck it in the bottom, left corner of the driver's side mirror and I can now see much more of what is going on in the next lane.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G. Friar Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Handy blindspot mirror.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, they work. My truck is too old to have any Blind Spot Monitoring Systems. Pick a spot on your mirror and stick them on. The little socket that holds the mirror to the base is pretty sturdy. The only thing that moves them is the wind tunnel at a carwash. They keep me safer on the road. Especially when I am towing.
customer_reviews.author: Alan rybak

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality
customer_reviews.text: I have always used wide angle mirrors so when I got my new used car last week it didn't have blind spot mirrors. These were very affordable and fit my stock mirrors just fine. Not too big or to small. More people need to use these then there would be less accidents.
customer_reviews.author: Art Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Work very well
customer_reviews.text: I can't comment yet on durability/quality issues because I have only had these installed approx 2 months, but so far so good. No visible scratches on the reflective part yet. The number one issue to be aware of is that they are very adjustable - up, down and side-to-side - so when you are wiping your rearview mirrors you will almost certainly knock at least one out of whack. Just learn to work around them as best you can :-)
customer_reviews.author: Wylie Merritt III

customer_reviews.title: Improve vision to rear and side.
customer_reviews.text: I use these on the rear view mirrors on my new Jeep Cherokee. I mounted them on the bottom of the mirrors as that seems to leave the rest of the mirrors unobstructed. I find them to be a great aid to seeing what is in back of me and what is approaching and to the side of my vehicle. Very happy I purchased these and recommend them to others.
customer_reviews.author: Lone Star

customer_reviews.title: Great spotters
customer_reviews.text: Using these on my new truck worked out perfectly for spotting the roller skate cars that like to hide in my blind spot. Sure with I bought them for my last truck. Without them I ran into a lego looking car (fiat) and totaled my 4x4. The darn roller skate car needed a new bumper. But hey I got a new truck and smart enough to use these little spotter mirrors as needed
customer_reviews.author: Ryan walker

customer_reviews.title: Poor visibility, not as good as the standard 2" round blind spot mirrors
customer_reviews.text: I usually use round blind spot mirrors but decided to give this a try. They were terrible. first of all, too thin in general, I could only see HALF of the cars. I tried adjusting but the visibility just wasn't good enough. It might be that I am used to using round mirrors as this product did get many good reviews. Returned the item and went with the standard round blind spot mirrors.
customer_reviews.author: LP115

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: These mirrors are not made with premium materials, but that is what makes them affordable. They adhered well and stay put and in the correct angle all the time. They are wide, thus offering better view than round ones. They have helped me a lot while driving in heavy DC traffic where having to change lanes constantly is routine. Winter is here. We'll see how they handle the weather.
customer_reviews.author: EJP

customer_reviews.title: You can’t see anything that you already can without it.
customer_reviews.text: Please read all reviews about the viewing angle BEFORE buying this product! I bought it because of so many positive reviews but the word “wide” in the product description refers to the physical width of the product, NOT the viewing angle. No matter how it’s adjusted, by the time you would see anything in its, you’d already see the same either in the original car mirror or the corner of your eyes. Also, if you really want to try it yourself, use masking tape to position it on your mirror. Easier to take down and return it. Would give it zero star if given the option.
customer_reviews.author: GY

customer_reviews.title: I would keep looking
customer_reviews.text: My problem with these is that WILL NOT stay put. When you wash the car, or dry it or go through a car wash they will move all over the place and you have to reset them which gets aggravating in short order. I like the design field of vision but wish they could be set or stabilized. Oh well, on to something different.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Only had them mounted for a couple of months but the sticker appears pretty strong. They can be easily adjusted left-right
customer_reviews.text: As advertised... they get the job done. Only had them mounted for a couple of months but the sticker appears pretty strong. They can be easily adjusted left-right, up-down.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: I see.... Everything..
customer_reviews.text: Honestly. Its hard to sit here and even check my blindspot anymore. Having this mirror allows me to look to my right and be able to see both a car’s headlight AND tail light at the same time. In other words, its really really really hard for a car to be in my blindspot now. Unless it is a tiny car or motorcycle, I will definitely see it in the mirror or out the window. Must have for any vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the adjustable feature, and very clear
customer_reviews.text: Very nice pair; good size and price and the adjustable feature lets me put the car mirror in one position and the spot mirror in another; nice and clear
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but you only need one.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mirror ... on the driver side. I found that the one on the right side obscured too much of the view, so I removed it and threw it away. I also have a blind spot indicator (car is brand new ), but like to be able to actually see what is out there, and this provides a great view. Only negative? I paid for two and am only using one. Honestly, though, I don't even know if they can be purchased separately.
customer_reviews.author: Jerseygirl

customer_reviews.title: Careful,get it right the first time.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the extra viewing angle. Be careful to get the location right the first time. I would suggest to have someone hold it in the location for you so that when you are ready its right. If you guess, these things will be stuck for good in that spot. The ability to tilt them helps but in my case I put it a little too close to the edge and I can't tilt to much because it hits the side of my mirror case. Again, not a problem with the product, but instead my issue installing it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Don't install vertically.
customer_reviews.text: Great blind spot mirrors. In the direction it shows that you can install vertically. Don't do that. I tried and it really limits your field of view. Took some work to get it off my mirror so that I could put it back on horizontally. Way better horizontally. Would recommend this to anyone. Visibility at night with it is good.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Shipley

customer_reviews.title: They are not a perfect solution but havn't fallen off and once adjusted correctly ...
customer_reviews.text: Put them on a Tacoma Pick Up Truck. They are not a perfect solution but havn't fallen off and once adjusted correctly they work just fine. Wanted a inexpensive solution and these work pretty good. They are lite plastic which I expected so 4 Stars is what they get. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: CHIPTOYOU

customer_reviews.title: Great blindspot detection but not durable
customer_reviews.text: I had no issue using this and I really like this blindspot since its width is long enough that I do not have to squint my eyes. The only issue I had was one of the mirror detached during a car wash. But it is replaceable and it is not expensive. I still highly recommend getting this for your side mirror.
customer_reviews.author: ned

customer_reviews.title: GREAT product !
customer_reviews.text: It eliminates the blind spots in both of my Odyssey vans. I bought a friend a set & he's sold as well & feels safer for him & his wife. It only takes a glance to get a good view , once you adapt to using them in your driving habits. Just that split second could be the difference in avoiding a collision.I recommend them for everybody , old & young alike.
customer_reviews.author: drkilobravo

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy- waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: What is the point of a mirror if I moves all the time and doesn’t show you blind spot. Most of the time they show me the sky...... not what I was looking for. I cannot return due to installing them but would return them if I could.
customer_reviews.author: sharra

customer_reviews.title: Works for frs blind spots
customer_reviews.text: I got a new Scion FR-S and found out the drivers side has the worst blind spots ever. I couldn’t just blindly throw myself into lanes so I bought these to help. Adhesive is super sticky, once on, will not come off without breaking something so make sure ur happy with placement. Has been on for more than 3 months, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Great mirror for car safety!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Suggest you sit in your car & have someone else hold it in different places before you decide on final placement. Adhesive is very strong, don't count on being able to move this once it is attached! Easy to adjust the angle for a great view, really does eliminate the dangerous blind spots!
customer_reviews.author: Gene Grim

customer_reviews.title: Solid, but quite large without optimal field of view enhancement for size.
customer_reviews.text: Sticks on great, easy to position and doesn't wiggle around at all. But, I don't really get the field of view I was expecting for something so large. Especially only seeing a strip of road and not great vertical vision. They're about 3" long by 1" wide. I had better view with a 1.5" round circular mirror. If you have smaller mirrors, this will take up a significant portion of the mirror.
customer_reviews.author: ZrowGz

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the round ones.
customer_reviews.text: I put these on my van and I don't like them at all. For me, they do not allow me to see surroundings as well as the round ones, which I had for years. These looked neat so I bought them. I am going back to the round ones right away. This was a waste for me personally. You may like them, but they are not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Neil R.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! The wide lens is perfect for the many lanes of Atlanta traffic. It's saved me a few times when people were coming into the lane I'm going into at the same time. Everyone should have blind spot checkers on their car. It's so much safer to take a quick glance at the little mirror rather than turn your whole head around to merge.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Neh....?
customer_reviews.text: While these wide-angle mirrors do what they claim and are easy to install, adhere like your tongue would to a frozen flagpole, and stay exactly where you aim them, but for my truck they seem way too small to be practical. It takes a good bit of concentration to focus on such a small area and check for vehicles in your blind spot. They might work on auto mirrors but I went a 2X larger add-on for my truck.
customer_reviews.author: REO

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews of how to properly install this mirror I was very careful to place it properly. This item also comes with good instructions. It has worked well and gives me a better overall view on the rear view mirror on the passenger side.
customer_reviews.author: Monika

customer_reviews.title: ok ok !!!
customer_reviews.text: purchased this for my toyota corolla to used as blindspot soptter , i am able to use successfully only on one side other side while sticking it fitted wrongly and it doesn't give me the correct blind spot , also glasses are little big in size to use a blind spot spotter.
customer_reviews.author: Mangsko

customer_reviews.title: Great viewing angles
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if these would provide quite enough angle to cover everything, but by the time a car has come too far forward to be seen in the blind spot mirrors, it can easily be seen in my peripheral vision in the side window. Installing was super easy; just sticks onto the existing side mirror. It's more or less stable but a couple hard door slams have occasionally moved it a little. A note I didn't realize: These are adjustable up/down and left/right as they're mounted on a ball&socket joint. Very pleasant surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R.

customer_reviews.title: Good mirror additions
customer_reviews.text: Our van doesn't have the best blind spot detection, so we bought these for a little help. They have stuck through long rainy vacation trips without issue. They also adjust whenever you need them to, but don't move around after set, which is great.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Guthrie

customer_reviews.title: Great for blind spots
customer_reviews.text: These mirrors are well made for the price. They make driving much safer as I have difficulties with turning my head. I have no problem seeing my blind spot. The fact that they are adjustable and move in all directions makes them very helpful with my eyesight I have not used these at night so cannot give a review on night driving I would highly recommend this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: May save your life
customer_reviews.text: These mirrors give a great view of what is back behind and to the side of you. I used them all the time for land changes. Absolutely the greatest value for money purchase I ever made. I mount the in the middle of the bottom of the mirror and tilt the out. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Almost great.
customer_reviews.text: They greatly improve your ability to see blind spots. Even 4 lanes over in traffic. Only downside is...they move when the door is being closed. You get back in and the mirrors have moved causing you to have to adjust them all the time. The swivel mount is not adjustable and too loose as is to hold the settings.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton

customer_reviews.title: Changed the game for me
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly easier to drive now. I do not have to turn my head all the way to left or right side. Looking through the passenger side is really easy now. The reach for the glass is super and it is simple to rotate or move to better see. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Unique Karki

customer_reviews.title: Good product as it’s adjustable.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good product. Worth the buy as you will know how much it helps spotting the vehicle in blind spots on either side. It is placeable strategically without affecting the view in main mirror. Better than circular ones. (Avoid pressure wash on them as it could change the position and you’d need to re-adjust)
customer_reviews.author: Cyclist38

customer_reviews.title: Useful but cheap mount is too loose
customer_reviews.text: This greatly aids in visibility. However the mount has a pivot that is a little loose, and I find I have to frequently readjust them, which is particularly annoying for the passenger side because I have to adjust, then check the view from the drivers seat, adjust again, etc. they will shift in the car wash as well.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: What a difference!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these mirrors because I thought their profile would match the profile of my outside mirrors... they were indeed a very good fit. I love that they adjust! With many others you are stuck with only one position, which may not be the most optimal one. These mirrors can be moved side to side and up and down to get the best view. They stick solidly to the OEM mirror and great enhance viewing ability. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: G.J.R.

customer_reviews.title: Great mirror for the price
customer_reviews.text: Fit my 2009 Toyota perfectly. I can't really say how easy to install. I paid my mechanic $75 to install which he did in about half hour. For me it was worth it. I did't like pulling my inside door panel off and was afraid to break the pins. He had no problem installing. If you go to Toyota to get this mirror your looking at at least $150 . All in all the mirror is clear with a wide view. very important mirror to cover that passenger side of your drive.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap, broke within the first week. Even before they broke, I found that they didn't work very well and I had to strain my eyes just to look into them. Id suggest buying the larger attachments that actually fit on top or below your side mirrors, over something that attaches like this
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Neck saving
customer_reviews.text: With these my range of visibility is so much better than before. Easy to place (backs are very sticky so be sure in your placement). I placed mine on the lower outside corner of my mirrors and I can see everything! Great for driving and backing out of spots. Easy to adjust your eyes to (not super magnified).
customer_reviews.author: Amanda K

customer_reviews.title: Improves blind spot visibility
customer_reviews.text: Easy to apply and so far it's doing a great job of alerting me to vehicles in the blind spot on both sides of my car. You can adjust the position of the mirror to improve coverage area.
customer_reviews.author: JJinHI

customer_reviews.title: oh these have been a godsend! My biggest fear ...
customer_reviews.text: oh these have been a godsend! My biggest fear is pulling in front of someone. No need to worry now
customer_reviews.author: Rose Petals

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well. I made sure to scrub my mirror with isopropyl alcohol and allowing it to dry before applying it. So far it's going through a New England winter and it hasn't fallen off. I do wish that it was a little bit taller. It definitely is a little on the smaller side, but that's what I figured.
customer_reviews.author: Darko

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Mirrors!!!
customer_reviews.text: These little guys do the trick for eliminating blind spots. We use them on our RV mirrors, and they work beautifully. We love the fact they they can swivel a bit so we can aim them just where we want them.
customer_reviews.author: Eric33948

customer_reviews.title: Takes care of that blind spot.
customer_reviews.text: I like this blind spot mirror, the adhesion could not be better, find the right spot first because once it's stuck it's there, I recommend sticking it on with masking tape to find the area you want it before you peel off the double back tape, it's great because it will pivot for your blind spot area.
customer_reviews.author: bret smith

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you take the time to set up
customer_reviews.text: I run these on my Ford Escape. It helps SO much with daily driving and merging lanes. I put mine in the bottom corner and they stick incredibly well. If you take the time of someone adjusting them outside the car while you are inside it helps a lot. They stay in place in wind and rain, only time had to re adjust them is after went through car wash. Would recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Functions as intended
customer_reviews.text: I only use this for blindspots. I probably could have placed it in a better spot to cover a more wider range but I placed it at the bottom left/right of my side mirrors. Once you stick it, it's hard to take off so place wisely. 4/5
customer_reviews.author: Tony Wong

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mirrors to see the blind spot at night.
customer_reviews.text: I bought and used other round models and at night it was difficult for me to see when I had cars in the blind spot, but not with this one, for which I feel extremely pleased. I recommend it to all those who, like me, find it difficult to see the blind spot at night.
customer_reviews.author: Reinaldo Gibert

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: We like these a lot. They really do widen the field of vision. My only problem is that they fall off every time we go through the car wash!
customer_reviews.author: Madamma62

customer_reviews.title: Takes abuse of the weather and stays stuck
customer_reviews.text: Have had it on our car for about a year and it still is there, so it stays put really well. We live in a state where we get snow, ice, rain, heat, ect. so it has taken the abuse of the weather and remains on the car.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Kline

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Does it Purpose to See your Blind Spot. So easy to install. you can remove it and install it again with No Problem, as long as no dirt on the adhesive part and in the surface you will put on.
customer_reviews.author: RAPsTeR

customer_reviews.title: Nice View
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a Kia Sportage, which don't have big side mirrors. After applying this mirror though there is still plenty of room left to easily view from both. The ball/socket movement is tight and stays in place.
customer_reviews.author: James T

customer_reviews.title: One was disconnected from the base (broken) right out of ...

customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: So far so good 👍 I just had to figure where to put them on my truck mirrors. Even though I have blind sensors these help to view the lanes as well as my trailer behind me when I pull it.
customer_reviews.author: lash

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gadget
customer_reviews.text: I used to have one of these on my other car I got this one now for my new car + for the 360 angle adjustment not only up and down + for 3M tape which will never ever come out again only if i hammered the mirror down 😂😂 (so make sure to try it a couple of times before you remove the adhesion mask to find the perfect spot) + big area of view really handy for fast cornering or switching lanes without having the doubt that someone maybe in my blind spot.
customer_reviews.author: Hossam E.

customer_reviews.title: Great little mirror with a slim, wide angle view
customer_reviews.text: I like the width. They give a great slim wide angle view, while still allowing for a large portion of the the stock mirror to be used. Ref: They are on stock mirrors of a 2009 Toyota Matrix.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Too easy to move
customer_reviews.text: Great optical clarity, size and shape. The issue is I have to readjust them after my car goes through the car wash, no way to lock them in place...very annoying and make them less useful for me 80% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Results
customer_reviews.text: These doesn’t help at all, they don’t explain very well the installation, now I cannot remove them because I am afraid to break the car mirror, do not buy this kind, it is useless
customer_reviews.author: Ayana

customer_reviews.title: Awesome blind spot. The Best on the market
customer_reviews.text: These are the best blind side mirrors I've ever used. They give the best view of your blind spots. You can change lanes with confidence. Love them, they are on all my vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Barbra Das

customer_reviews.title: Good image
customer_reviews.text: Clearer and larger image than most. Works well on rear view mirror as well as side view mirror. I attached it to the right side of the rear view mirror and was able to see part of the rear window and side window.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: For the manufacturer: make it bigger!
customer_reviews.text: Affordable little blind spot mirrors, Easy to install, the the tape really strong and adjustable. But it will be better if the height and width for mirror increase in size.
customer_reviews.author: Whatever

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all!!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have good adhesiveness, it fell off one day while driving and a car must have crushed it behind me!! Very bad and while I had been using it, I didn't like how confusing this was.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: I Love seeing my blind spot...MAKES IT SO SAFE
customer_reviews.text: Took me a while to get to use to these mirrors. Now it's easy. I look in the big mirror and before I change lanes I check the small blind spot mirror to make sure. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: this mirror is too small and the convex bend does not increase image size enough. Also the tilt turn ball joint was not tight enough and would change position with road vibration and wind. Worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick L.

customer_reviews.title: Great! The best here! Better then the circle ones I’d say.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I would say to try different install points on your mirror, like the far left, as there is not much room for play on these. I’d like for them to be bigger and stick a little higher out so to have more play for greater view.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. Cauthen

customer_reviews.title: Wide View
customer_reviews.text: They were easy to put on and are easy to clean. I previously had round ones but this is much better because they're shaped like a rectangle, so you get a better view.
customer_reviews.author: m erenthal

customer_reviews.title: They are OK, but the quality may not be consistently the best.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two 2-packs for my wife's car and mine. Overall I am happy with the added visibility, three of them work perfectly. One of the mirrors is very loose and keeps dropping down with the slightest vibration. I kept trying to re-adjust but I'm giving up, it's a quality issue. I hope you get good ones.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Great Mirrors
customer_reviews.text: I really like these blind spot mirrors. They adhere to mirror with no problems. I love that they are adjustable. Allows me to perfectly position on the blind spot.
customer_reviews.author: mweave22

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't give you enough vertical viewing
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize how short these are in the smaller dimension, which means you barely get to see up and down much. This was a deal breaker for me since I use these little mirrors to see the parking lines more clearly, and I couldn't do that with these. Returned them and got regular round ones instead.
customer_reviews.author: Rifdhan

customer_reviews.title: Almost a great thing
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and they seem to be holding, but the image is so small and squished that it is nearly useless. I wonder if the circular ones would work better.

customer_reviews.title: Best options for Blindspot
customer_reviews.text: Tried couple different ones before and had issues with alignment and issues With adhesive but this one has a 3M adhesive and it’s adjustable worst great
